page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: This block is a very flat area comprising mainly arable land and Forestry Commission softwood plantations. About one third of this area is owned by the Ministry of Defence as part of a military training area. The village of Ickburgh has approximately sixty-three houses (more are being erected). The main sources of employment are Manor Farm at Ickburgh and the sand/gravel quarry at Lynford. There is also a small factory producing wooden pallets at the Old Rectory, Ickburgh. Lynford Hall is a Country Club abd Motel, and has, in its grounds, a small 'Luxury Mobile Homes' static park.
